page.title: 03Laindon Past and Present
page.content: Mr Davis was interviewed during the survey. He could remember cutting corn for farmers in a meadow which has been covered by the houses at Roberts Road. The only main road ran from Little Burstead to Laindon Station, but in 1928 the A127 was opened by the Duke of Gloucester. Even by 1950 there were few cars in the area, unlike today. In 1940 Mr Davis had left Laindon to join the Army. Laindon High Street had a number of shops and was the busiest part of Basildon. Now most of the shops have closed and the Laindon Centre has been opened but even this is dwarfed by Basildon Eastgate. Mr Davis had bought a plot of land for his house for 5 pounds but now it is worth 50,000 pounds.
